javadoc: VariousChoicesPanel provides a table type of format for resolving multiple conflicts in one panel. Each row that has choices represents the choices for a single conflict. So each row can have multiple radio buttons or multiple check boxes. At least one choice must be made in each row that provides choices before this panel will indicate that all choices are resolved.

methods.javadoc: Constructor for a various choices panel.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor for a various choices panel.

methods.javadoc:
Constructor for a various choices panel.
@param isDoubleBuffered
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor for a various choices panel.

methods.javadoc:
This sets the text that appears as the border title of this panel.
@param conflictType the type of conflict being resolved.
methods.name: setTitle
methods.comment: This sets the text that appears as the border title of this panel.

params.name: conflictType
params.comment: the type of conflict being resolved.

methods.javadoc:
This sets the header text that appears above the table.
@param text the text
methods.name: setHeader
methods.comment: This sets the header text that appears above the table.

methods.name: addInfoRow
methods.comment:
Adds a row to the table that doesn't provide any choices. 
 Instead this row just provides information.

params.name: title
params.comment: title the is placed at the beginning of the row

params.name: info
params.comment: the text for each table column in the row

params.name: underline
params.comment:
true indicates each info string should be underlined 
 when it appears. (Underlining is done on the header row (row 0) of the table.

methods.name: addSingleChoice
methods.comment:
Adds radiobutton choices as a row of the table.
 Radiobuttons allow you to select only one choice in the row.

params.name: title
params.comment: title the is placed at the beginning of the row

params.name: choices
params.comment: the text for each choice in the row

params.name: listener
params.comment:
listener that gets notified whenever the state of 
 one of the radiobuttons in this row changes.

methods.name: addMultipleChoice
methods.comment:
Adds checkbox choices as a row of the table.
 Check boxes allow you to select one or more choices in the row.

params.name: title
params.comment: title the is placed at the beginning of the row

params.name: choices
params.comment: the text for each choice in the row

params.name: listener
params.comment:
listener that gets notified whenever the state of 
 one of the checkboxes in this row changes.

methods.name: getComponentName
methods.comment: Gets a generic name for a component in the table.

return.comment: the default name of the indicated component in the table.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table.
methods.name: allChoicesAreResolved
methods.comment: Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table and 
 made the same choice for every row.
methods.name: allChoicesAreSame
methods.comment:
Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table and 
 made the same choice for every row.

methods.javadoc: Removes header text for this panel and all table/row information.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Removes header text for this panel and all table/row information.

methods.javadoc:
Adjusts the enablement of the Use For All checkbox based on whether choices have been made 
 for all the conflicts currently on the screen and whether the same choice was made for all 
 conflicts on the screen.
methods.name: adjustUseForAllEnablement
methods.comment:
Adjusts the enablement of the Use For All checkbox based on whether choices have been made 
 for all the conflicts currently on the screen and whether the same choice was made for all 
 conflicts on the screen.

name: VariousChoicesPanel
comment:
VariousChoicesPanel provides a table type of format for resolving
 multiple conflicts in one panel. Each row that has choices represents the
 choices for a single conflict. 
 So each row can have multiple radio buttons or multiple check boxes.
 At least one choice must be made in each row that provides choices before 
 this panel will indicate that all choices are resolved.
